Key Match Events: Tyrese Maxey scored the go-ahead basket with 23.7 seconds left to preserve the win for the 76ers.
Guerschon Yabusele blocked a potential tying layup with 14 seconds left to seal the win for the 76ers.
Pre-Game Insights: The 76ers played without Joel Embiid, Paul George, Kyle Lowry, and Andre Drummond, while the Wizards played without leading scorer Jordan Poole and Malcolm Brogdon.
Post-Match Reflections: The 76ers won the game 109-103, improving their chances in the NBA.
The Wizards have lost four straight games and six of seven, and have the worst record in the NBA at 6-29.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tickets on the secondary market were going for less than $10 each in the lower 100 level right before tipoff.
Washington made only 6 of 9 free throws.
Others: Tyrese Maxey struggled at times as the go-to scorer this season with Embiid and George out so often.
Bilal Coulibaly helped Washington rally from a 16-point hole and stretched the lead to 101-98 on a jumper.
